title: Adv Microeconomic Analys
description: Review of important mathematical tools and techniques used in advanced microeconomics.  Advanced topics include the estimation of demand and cost functions; the role of government in the economy (externalities, property rights, and public goods); public choice theory; factor markets (especially labor and capital markets); models of monopoly; pricing techniques used by firms with market power (monopolies and oligopolies); and game theory.
restrictions: __HEADER_0__Must be enrolled in one of the following Campuses:
prerequisites: ECON 2100 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or ECON 2106 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or ECON 2101 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D
